title: Fantik‑style studio site
tagline: Motion-first homepage + case study system for a design studio

blocks.title: Context
blocks.body: The studio needed a homepage that could sell craft in seconds, then back it up with case studies — without turning into a template. The goal was a high-contrast, typography-led layout with deliberate motion.

blocks.title: What shipped
blocks.body: A modular section system (hero, services, featured works, clients, contact), route transitions, and an API-backed works catalogue with prefetch-on-hover for instant navigation.

blocks.caption: Early structure: content-first sections with a motion layer on top.

blocks.title: Design notes
blocks.body: We kept the motion curve consistent across the site, used reduced-motion fallbacks, and treated spacing as a system — so the site stays “calm” even when animated.

title: Product launch kit
tagline: Campaign page, modular blocks, and analytics-ready layout

cover.alt: Product team collaborating over a laptop

gallery.alt: Product team collaborating over a laptop

blocks.title: Challenge
blocks.body: Ship a launch page that marketing can iterate on daily, while keeping layout and typography consistent. The build had to be resilient to copy changes and long headlines.

blocks.caption: Modular blocks: the page can be rearranged without breaking rhythm.

blocks.title: Result
blocks.body: A component library for hero, social proof, pricing, FAQ, and CTAs — plus interaction patterns that highlight key decisions without distracting.

title: Studio portfolio v2
tagline: Scrolling narrative, fast navigation, and crisp typography

cover.alt: Clean design grid on a screen

gallery.alt: Clean design grid on a screen

blocks.title: Approach
blocks.body: A rhythm of dense and quiet sections: big headlines, short captions, and micro-interactions that guide focus. Motion is used to confirm navigation, not to decorate.

blocks.caption: A grid-first system keeps pages consistent as content grows.

title: Interactive case study
tagline: Case study template with gallery controls and prefetch

cover.alt: People reviewing a product UI together

gallery.alt: People reviewing a product UI together

blocks.title: Details
blocks.body: Prefetched data, motion transitions, and accessible navigation. Designed for speed and clarity — the detail view should feel instant even on repeated visits.

blocks.caption: The template supports long-form narratives: text, images, and structured highlights.

title: Editorial landing
tagline: Typography-led layout with calm motion and clear hierarchy

cover.alt: Open book and editorial desk scene

gallery.alt: Open book and editorial desk scene

blocks.title: Typography
blocks.body: Large, tight headings paired with calm body text — a layout that can breathe on every viewport. We tuned line-length and spacing for scanning.

blocks.caption: Hierarchy is the product: the motion just reinforces it.

title: Micro‑interactions pack
tagline: Small interaction details that feel expensive — and accessible

cover.alt: Code editor and UI components on a screen

gallery.alt: Code editor and UI components on a screen

blocks.title: Focus
blocks.body: Hover states, keyboard focus, and reduced-motion variants. Smooth does not mean inaccessible — every interaction has a clear non-motion equivalent.

blocks.caption: A tiny library of UI patterns: cards, menus, progress, and safe transitions.
